entry.et: Middle English hamer, from Old English hamor; akin to Old High German hamar hammer, and perhaps to Old Church Slavic kamen-, kamy stone, Greek akmē point, edge edge

def.dt: :a hand tool consisting of a solid head set crosswise on a handle and used for pounding
:a power tool that often substitutes a metal block or a drill for the hammerhead
:something that resembles a hammer in form or action: as
:a lever with a striking head for ringing a bell or striking a gong
:an arm that strikes the cap in a percussion lock to ignite the propelling charge
:a part of the action of a modern gun that strikes the primer of the cartridge in firing or that strikes the firing pin to ignite the cartridge
:malleus
:gavel
:a padded mallet in a piano action for striking a string
:a hand mallet for playing on various percussion instruments (as a xylophone)
:a metal sphere thrown for distance in the hammer throw
:accelerator b
:for sale at auction
:to strike blows especially repeatedly with or as if with a hammer :pound
:to make repeated efforts
:to reiterate an opinion or attitude the lectures all hammered away at the same points
:to beat, drive, or shape with repeated blows of a hammer
:to fasten or build with a hammer
:to strike or drive with a force suggesting a hammer blow or repeated blows hammered the ball over the fence tried to hammer me into submission
:to criticize severely
:an emblem consisting of a crossed hammer and sickle used especially as a symbol of Soviet Communism
:with great force, vigor, or violence went at it hammer and tongs
:dulcimer 1 called also hammered dulcimer
:a grinder or crusher in which materials are broken up by hammers
:to produce or bring about as if by repeated blows hammered out an agreement

entry.et: from the hammer used by the auctioneer to signal the auction's end

def.dt: :the price at which an item is sold at auction
:a field event in which a usually 16-pound metal sphere attached to a flexible handle is thrown for distance
:a hammer having a hemispherical peen at one end of its head
